qas.question: How was the Puerto Rican constitution brought about?

answers.text: the U.S. Congress directed local government to organize a constitutional convention to write the Puerto Rico Constitution

qas.question: When was the Puerto Rican constitution written?
When was the constitution accepted by the electorate, U.S. Congress, and U.S. President?
What clause gives Puerto Rican citizens the same rights as US citizens?

plausible_answers.text: the U.S. Congress directed local government to organize a constitutional convention

qas.question: How was the Puerto Rican Congress brought about?
When was the Puerto Rican Congress established?
When was the constitution accepted by the electorate, Puerto Rico Congress, and U.S. President?
What clause gives Congress the same rights as Puerto Rican citizens?

plausible_answers.text: when the U.S. Congress directed local government to organize a constitutional convention

qas.question: When were the express citizens created?

context: This constitution was created <b8_0>when <a0_0><b4_0>the U.S. Congress directed local government to organize a constitutional convention<b8_0/><b4_0/> to write the Puerto Rico Constitution<a0_0/> in <a1_0><b5_0>1951<b5_0/><a1_0/>. The acceptance of that constitution by Puerto Rico's electorate, the U.S. Congress, and the U.S. president occurred in <a2_0><b6_0>1952<b6_0/><a2_0/>. In addition, the rights, privileges and immunities attendant to United States citizens are "respected in Puerto Rico to the same extent as though Puerto Rico were a state of the union" through the express extension of the <a3_0><b7_0>Privileges and Immunities Clause<b7_0/><a3_0/> of the U.S. Constitution by the U.S. Congress in 1948.
